marketNews.title: Important Notes on RAPBN 2025 Financial Note
marketNews.content:
Indonesia's Ministry of Finance held a press conference on the 2025 State Budget Financial Note on Friday (16 August). Key market indices: IHSG 7,467 (+0.47%); Coal 150.5 (+0.83%); Oil (Brent) 79.0 (-0.81%); Gold 2,540 (+0.04%); CPO 3,722 (+1.11%); Nickel 16,373 (+0.33%).
- Subsidy budget increased, positive for consumption. The energy subsidy and compensation budget rose by 18% to 394 trillion rupiah, with the highest increase recorded in electricity subsidy and energy compensation. This increase, higher than the assumed exchange rate weakening, reflects the government's intent to preserve consumer purchasing power amid a projected global economic slowdown in 2025. Non‑energy subsidies and their reserves also rose significantly (+36%), driven in part by an increase in fertilizer subsidy quota from 6‑7 million tons to 9 million tons in 2025.
- Nutrition‑free meal program budget included in RAPBN 2025 at 71 trillion rupiah, targeting about 20 million students in under‑developed areas, with an initial capex of around 20 trillion rupiah, implying an expenditure of roughly 10,000 rupiah per child per day. The government estimates this program will add 0.1 percentage point to economic growth in 2025.
- IKN (new capital city) budget only 143 billion rupiah (2024: 43 trillion rupiah), still a baseline figure that can be increased by the next administration.

marketNews.title: Gold price reaches record high
marketNews.content: Gold price rose by 2.04% to a level of 2,507.28 US dollars per troy ounce on Friday (16 August) night, marking the highest price ever recorded. The strengthening of gold occurred alongside a weakening US dollar index (DXY) of -0.57% on the same day, driven by rising expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts and concerns over geopolitical tensions in the Middle East and Ukraine.

marketNews.title: China coal production July 2024
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau reported that coal production in July 2024 grew by 2.8% year‑on‑year to 390.37 million tonnes. Meanwhile, thermal power generation, which largely relies on coal, fell by 4.9% year‑on‑year in July 2024 to 574.9 billion kWh, marking a three‑month consecutive annual decline despite overall energy consumption rising.

marketNews.title: President Joko Widodo inaugurates new cabinet
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo inaugurated a number of ministers and deputy ministers on Monday (19 August). Bahlil Lahadalia was appointed as Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, replacing the previous minister nominated by PDIP, Arifin Tasrif. The position previously held by Bahlil as Minister of Investment/Head of the Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM) was taken over by Rosan Roeslani. President Widodo also appointed Gerindra Party politician Supratman Andi Agtas as Minister of Law and Human Rights, replacing PDIP politician Yasonna Laoly. Additionally, Gerindra politician and former media director for Prabowo‑Gibran during the 2024 election, Angga Raka Prabowo, was appointed as Deputy Minister of Communication and Information Technology.

marketNews.title: ESDM Minister Bahlil Lahadalia focuses on oil lifting
marketNews.content: Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said he is committed to focusing on increasing oil lifting during the remaining two months of his tenure, which ends in October 2024. Oil lifting in the first half of 2024 reached 576,000 barrels per day, only 91% of the 2025 State Budget target of 635,000 barrels per day. The 2025 State Budget targets oil lifting of 600,000 barrels per day.

marketNews.title: Government debt position July 2024
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance reported that the government's debt position at the end of July 2024 reached 8,502.69 trillion rupiah, an increase of 57.82 trillion rupiah or 0.68% compared with the end of June 2024. Despite the rise in absolute debt, the debt‑to‑GDP ratio fell from 39.13% at the end of June 2024 to 38.68% at the end of July 2024.

marketNews.title: President appoints Dadan Hindayana as head of National Nutrition Agency
marketNews.content: President Joko Widodo inaugurated Dadan Hindayana as the Head of the National Nutrition Agency. The agency was established to implement the free nutritious meal program promoted by presidential candidate Prabowo Subianto, which is planned to start on 2 January 2025. Dadan is a lecturer at the Faculty of Agriculture, Bogor Agricultural University.

marketNews.title: PKB joins Indonesia Maju coalition for Jakarta gubernatorial election
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the National Awakening Party (PKB), Hasanuddin Wahid, said the party has joined the Indonesia Maju Coalition for the Jakarta 2024 gubernatorial election. The coalition, consisting of 12 parties, officially declared on Monday (19 August) that Ridwan Kamil and Justice Party (PKS) politician Suswono will be the coalition's candidates for governor and deputy governor of Jakarta.

tickerNews.title: Tax on Sweetened Beverages and Tobacco Products Impact on Consumer Companies
tickerNews.content: The government targets a 6% increase in tax revenue in 2025 to 244 trillion rupiah, partly through limited extension of excise tax on sweetened beverages in packaging (MBDK). The MBDK excise target for the 2024 State Budget was 4.4 trillion rupiah, but it has not been implemented yet because technical regulations have not been released. Qualitatively, the negative impact on consumer company profitability can be minimized because companies can launch lower‑sugar products and pass on part of the tax to prices. Mayora Indah ($MYOR), which has 25‑30% of its revenue exposed to MBDK tax, is expected to feel the greatest impact, followed by Jamu and Pharmaceutical company Sido Muncul ($SIDO) with about 15‑20% revenue exposure.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway: Tobacco Producers Share Gains
tickerNews.content: In today's trading, Monday (19/8), tobacco producer stocks closed with significant gains – $HMSP rose 15.79%, $GGRM rose 8.18%, and $WIIM rose 8.79% – possibly due to expectations of a more favorable excise tax policy.

tickerNews.title: BNII Rumored Acquisition of JMAS
tickerNews.content: Maybank Indonesia ($BNII) is reported to be in talks to acquire 60% of the shares of Sharia Life Insurance Jasa Mitra Abadi ($JMAS). The controlling shareholder of JMAS, Koperasi Simpan Pinjam Jasa, which holds about 58% of JMAS, set a valuation of over 200 billion rupiah for 100% of the shares, while BNII is said to be offering between 100 and 150 billion rupiah. BNII's President Director, Steffano Ridwan, said the bank has no acquisition plan. JMAS President Director, Basuki Agus, said several parties are interested but the decision rests with shareholders.

tickerNews.title: TPIA Exploring IPO for Chandra Daya Investasi
tickerNews.content: In an information disclosure to the IDX, Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) confirmed that the company is exploring the possibility of an IPO for PT Chandra Daya Investasi, a subsidiary operating in infrastructure. The plan is still under internal discussion. Earlier, Chandra Asri Pacific's President Director, Suryandi, said in early August 2024 that TPIA was opening opportunities to list PT Chandra Daya Investasi on the stock exchange.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Reports 7M24 Gas Sales Volume
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS) recorded gas sales volume of 847 BBTUD (down 9% YoY) during the first seven months of 2024, 11% below the 2024 management target. Of this volume, 55% was contributed by HGBT users and the remainder by non‑HGBT users. Gas transmission volume reached 1,490 MMSCFD (up 4% YoY), 2% below the 2024 target. LNG sales volume was 43 BBTUD (up 100% YoY), 66% below the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: INKP Share Purchase by PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper ($INKP), PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada, bought 30 million INKP shares at a price of 9,000 rupiah per share on 14 August 2024. The transaction value amounted to 270 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT APP Purinusa Ekapersada's ownership in INKP increased from 56.57% to 57.12%.

tickerNews.title: ELSA Advances Chemical EOR Projects
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Elnusa ($ELSA), Bachtiar Soeria Atmadja, said the company has completed a chemical enhanced oil recovery (EOR) study in ten work area structures owned by PT Pertamina Hulu Energi and one structure in a block owned by another oil company. ELSA targets at least one chemical EOR project to go live in 2024 with an extended simulation scheme. At the end of 2023, ELSA signed a memorandum of understanding with China's Daqing Oilfield Company Ltd. for chemical EOR development.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Launches Radioisotope Production Facility
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma ($KLBF), through its subsidiary PT Global Onkolab Farma, inaugurated the groundbreaking of a radioisotope and radiopharmaceutical production facility in Surabaya. The plant will produce fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) for early cancer detection and will serve hospitals in East Java. This is KLBF's second radioisotope production facility, after the groundbreaking of a similar plant in Jakarta in early February 2024. The President Director of KLBF, Vidjongtius, said that each facility costs between 150 and 200 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: RAAM Share Sale by Tripar Multivision Plus
tickerNews.content: Tripar Multivision Plus's controlling shareholder, Ram Jethmal Punjabi, sold approximately 365.2 million RAAM shares at a price of 497 rupiah per share between 12 and 15 August 2024. The transaction value reached 181.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Ram Jethmal Punjabi's ownership in RAAM decreased from 83.23% to 77.33%.

tickerNews.title: SAME Shares Purchased by EMTK
tickerNews.content: Sarana Meditama Metropolitan's controlling shareholder, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), bought 35.2 million SAME shares at an average price of 290 rupiah per share between 15 February and 14 August 2024. The total transaction value was 10.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, EMTK's ownership in SAME increased from 78.18% to 78.38%.
